solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = _{{trunc((pi_val*(k**2)*j)-(pi_val*((k-3)**2)*j), 2)}}_ \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (_{k}_)^2 \times _{j}_ - \pi (_{k}_-x)^2 \times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{_{j}_\pi}=_{k}_^2 - (_{k}_-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (_{k}_-x)^2 = _{{(k**2)}}_ - \frac{V}{_{j}_\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = _{k}_ - _{{ trunc( sqrt((k**2)-((pi_val*(k**2)*j)-(pi_val*((k-3)**2)*j))/(j*pi_val)) , 2) }}_\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

content.text: The volume of a metallic cylinder pipe is _{{trunc((pi_val*(k**2)*j)-(pi_val*((k-3)**2)*j), 2)}}_ cubic centimetres. Its length is _{j}_ cm and its external radius is _{k}_ cm. Find its thickness in cm
